alert.note: Alert for Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 12:33AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Sussex County through 100 AM EDT... At 1232 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over High Point, or near Matamoras, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Montague, Hopatcong, Mount Arlington, Franklin, Stanhope, Hamburg, Netcong, Ogdensburg, Sussex, Branchville, Andover, Flatbrookville, High Point, Lake Mohawk, Greendell, Vernon Valley, Five Points, Pellettown and Crandon Lakes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
